With hundreds of digital camera available, how do you locate the camera you need? You will find various manufacturers making a variety of digital cameras. And the funny thing is that a number of the companies shouldn't even be making these digital cameras primarily because the cameras they produce are terrible. Of course, when you are trying to find the best camera for you, you must have a list of things that the camera should have. Are you interested in a camera that is under $500, or do you want a camera that is at least $200? Do you want to take video, or do you only want a camera that will take photographs and then transfer the images to your computer?

When you know just what you want, you will be able to look through just the camera that fits your requirements. However, if you want the best possible quality, you will see that the traditional 35mm SLR camera will shoot better photos than just about any digital camera. But the reason you want to have a digital camera is so that you don't need to spend a considerable amount of money on getting the photos developed. Possibly another criteria is the media card, and possibly the 16 MB card that comes with the FinePix A303, or the 64 MB card that you can buy additionally to hold 250-300 high quality pictures. And if you opt to buy the 64 MB, card you should never have to worry about running out of space as you can delete the pictures once you transfer them to your PC.

The Fujifilm FinePix A303 is a nice small camera that has the ability to capture high quality images with the 3.2 mega pixels. You will love the 6x zoom that comes standard with this camera and you will also like the other features. And the ease of using the FinePix A303 is also something people like about this unit. But for those of you who also want to be able to record videos and sound, then this camera may not be the right option for you.

The first complaint that many people have about the Fujifilm FinePix A303 is that it uses up batteries rather fast. You do have the option to turn the view screen off and if you combine that with mostly taking photos outside where you don't need a flash, the batteries will last the same as other cameras. However, if you are using the flash for every shot and you keep the view screen turned on, you will discover that you are really going through the batteries. A lot of people have complained that they are losing pictures because of the review function when they are looking through the photographs they snapped. If you do not scroll all of the way to the end, when you start snaping more photos, they will overwrite the images you have in memory. This can easily be avoided by going to the end but if you forget you may lose several photos you really wanted to keep.

Several individuals have had complaints about the overall construction of the Fujifilm FinePix A303 saying that it is not very tough and durable. For the most part, virtually all of the reviews this camera has gotten have been good. Nearly all people understand that they are paying for a low end digital camera and that some quality has to be given up to be able to sell the camera for a cheaper price. If you are searching for affordability and decent quality, this could be the right camera for you. However, if you are searching for a top quality digital camera with all the best features, you may want to keep on looking.
